data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person can return to whatever position he wants to be in as long as he keeps his body facing forward. In this scenario, the person taking the step will be facing forward. The person who is taking the step backward would only be looking the opposite direction of where he is facing. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around takes 4 steps. Turn around takes 4 steps. Turn around takes right on straight track. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The instructions take you 6 steps away from the starting point. Walking back to the starting point, you would have to walk a long way to get home. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow the same instruction, you would return to the starting point in 7 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning left then back right is one of the final sequences. Taking 3 steps means you change direction again, so you take 3 steps, turn around and take 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turn around, turn around, turn around, turn around, turn around, turn around, turn around, turn around, turn around, turn around, turn around, turn around, turn around, turn around, turn around, turn around, turn around, turn around. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right 2 times, and take the same number of steps you took to get to the starting point. Take 8 steps + 9, and turn right there 2 times. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 6 steps and turn around. Take 8 steps and turn around. Take 2 steps at a total of 5 steps in the exercise. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 1 step left. Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

Let’ s say you take 3 steps and then turn 180 degrees and return to the starting point. Your starting point could be anywhere on the left side of the staircase. So, the answer is No.

When you take a step backwards the direction you were facing. When you take steps forward you are looking forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

First you point your body left and then turn slightly to face forward. Now, if you point right, and then turn slightly to the right, you take 6 steps right, which will bring you to the starting point. If you point left and then turn right, and then turn slightly to the left, you take 2 steps left. So, the answer is no.

It can never be back to the starting point from any point on the map. So, the answer is no.

Take 3 steps forward and then take 4 steps left. Keep looking forward as you progress. Take 1 step right and then repeat the steps. So, the answer is No.

The instructions should always lead to a starting point. The number of steps from where they start backward, not forward, will indicate how far in any direction you move. If they lead you back forward, you will take 3 steps right. So, the answer is No.

You can turn around after you have taken 7 steps. Turning around after you have taken 9 steps is the same as turning right. So, the answer is no.

You can’ t take back 10 steps from something else. If you are taking steps to turn around, you must be taking steps to return. So, the answer is No.

If you take 2 steps right in the first step, then you can take 2 steps forward in the next step. If you take 5 steps backward in the first step, then you can take 5 steps backward in the following steps. So, the answer is no.

If you face forward you need to always face forward to avoid getting into a dangerous situation. Taking 6 steps left is the opposite of taking 6 steps right. So, the answer is No.

In order to turn right, you must first turn right. You must first turn right. To turn around in order to turn around, you must first turn around. So, the answer is no.

If you face forward you will move 8 times faster than if you take 8 steps backward. So, the answer is No.

Backward starts from one point. Forward starts from the other point. When facing forward, we would be taking 10 steps right. Therefore, the answer is No.

Five steps is one – five is a multiple of five. 7 steps is one – seven is the same as 10 steps. The starting point of one- ten is t. Let’ s think again. So, the answer is Yes.

While facing forward, you should always take six steps backward. When you take 6 steps backward, you go back 6 inches to the starting point. When you take 4 steps backward, you go 3 inches backwards. When you take 8 steps backward, you move 3 inches to the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

When you start, you always move forward. If you exit at the starting point that leaves you facing backward and you take 4 steps. If you exit the starting point that leaves you facing forward and you take 5 steps. The first rematch is from your starting point. So, the answer is no.

Taking 1 step forward after 6 steps right equals 6 steps forward. There are 6 steps right after 4 steps right. Take 4 steps left after 4 steps left equals 4 steps left. There are 4 steps left after 8 steps left. You will also take 1 step forward after making an end. In fact the start is at 0.50 of the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you face backwards, you are always facing forward. Each of the steps represents a different direction. The number 1 represents 9 steps - 9 steps = 8 steps. Thus, the answer is Yes.

When you have gone away from it, it must always be facing forward. If you are facing forward, it’s no use looking back. You cannot go into the starting point, you are just backwards. So, the answer is no.

Before beginning, always face forward. After each series, take 8 steps backward. After each series, take 10 steps forward. When you take 7 steps backward, you should take 10 steps forward. When taking 10 steps forward, the series ends when you take 7 steps forward. If you don’ t start with 10 steps forward, you make a mistake by taking 10 steps backward. An incorrect set of steps will cause you to return to the starting point. The correct statement: No.
